content.description:
This is the right hand of two top-roped lines to the right on

OSHA

and

Explosion

.  Start with a roof on the right side of the face and climb fun moves up and over the roof to the top of the wall.  I had forgotten how fun this line is.
content.protection: There are two bolts on top to set it up.
content.location: This is on the right end of the Corporate Walls.

content.description:
This route is just right of

Explosion...

and offers about the same difficulty and length.  This is face climbing again, but the crux is pulling through a small roof with a long reach.  The cobbles at the crux are small and pumpy, so don't burn out hanging in the roof too long.  After you pull the crux, finish on easy ground to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 QDs and a few slings for the anchor, a triple cold shut.

content.description: Great face climbing on cobbles and edges--this line is the farthest left (facing the cliff) on the vertical wall.  Start by bouldering up an easy start to a large ledge.  Clip the first bolt here.  There is a 10d move at the second bolt, followed by an 11a move at the next bolt which are excellent.  The difficulty eases up until the last, balancy 10a move to the anchors.  Grab the jugs on top for a relieving finish to a fun route.
content.protection: 5 QDs and a few slings for the anchor, a triple cold shut.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
